## Definitions {.smaller}

**Definitions**	Measuring and Monitoring Biological Diversity: Standard Methods for Amphibians.  1994.  Eds, Heyer et al.
 
 - **Relative abundance**:  proportional representation of species in a sample
 - **Inventory**:  study of a specific area, site, or habitat to determine the number of species present (i.e. species richness)
 - **Monitoring**: study of the abundance of individuals in one or more populations of a species at a site through time
 - **Mark-recapture** techniques:  methods for determining population size that involve capturing, marking, and releasing animals, and subsequently recapturing or re-sighting them one or more times.
 - **Visual Encounter Survey (VES)**:  estimate the diversity (number of. different species) and abundance (number of different individuals) of animals at a particular location

::: footer
Definitions

# Decontamination {background-color="#111111"}

## Decon {.smaller}

::: {.columns .pv4}
::: {.column width="47%" .incremental}
 - Decontamination between and after sites is [critical]{.b .orange}
 - Before leaving a field site, thoroughly remove all organic matter (i.e., mud, algae, plants) from nets, sampling gear, boots/boot tread, clothing
 - Be especially cognizant of gear that came into contact with water or aquatic sediments
 
:::

::: {.column .tc .pv5 width="10%" .incremental}
:::

::: {.column .tc .pv5 width="43%" .incremental}

::: fragment
**Decon Steps**
:::

 1. Pre-rinse with water before cleaning with solution
 2. Clean with solution using appropriate dilution (Bleach, Quat)
 3. Allow solution to sit for necessary time (depends on treatment)
 4. Rinse off using hot water
 5. Wear appropriate PPE

:::

:::

::: footer
Decon
:::

## Decon: Bleach {.smaller}

 - [**Bleach at 1:32 concentration**]{.orange} works well, though hard on gear
 - breaks down quickly in environment, need fresh batch each time

![](../img/dilution_table_bleach.jpg){fig-align="center"}
